intro: Pygeum plagiocarpum, commonly known as the African wild almond, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy green leaves and showy white flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
